text: on Monday second day of a ceasefire
between Israel and Hamas Israel had
already begun pulling its troops out of
a devastated Gaza it was the first day
of actual calm neither Hamas nor is real
fired Israel meantime said that it
planned to have its troops out of gaza
by tuesday in a symbolic gesture to the
inauguration of barack obama in
washington in gaza Palestinians began
digging out after three weeks of
airstrikes and fighting between Hamas
and Israel Hamas members came out of
hiding donning their uniforms cleaning
up and directing traffic to share some
semblance of order in Gaza Hamas leaders
made statements saying that no matter
how destructed this war Israel had not
achieved its goal of crippling Hamas New
York Times correspondent ethan bronner
is in gaza city there was the first
government press conference today since
the war began and certainly since it
ended two spokesman the spokesman of the
Ministry of Interior V hobble insane and
the spokesman for the Prime Minister the
government spokesman called taher l nu
nu and these two men spoke about how
this has been a victory that Israel set
out in this war to defeat Hamas to stop
them from shipping rockets but in fact
throughout the war Hamas functioned
convey have plenty of rockets left so
clearly it was not successful their
point of view Hamas and Israel continued
to blame each other for the suffering of
civilians in Gaza many hundreds of women
and children were killed in the war New
York Times correspondent Sabrina tavern
AZ spent Monday assessing the damage
inside Gaza City I saw some of the areas
in gaza city that had had the most
destruction in the past few weeks one of
them was an area called wom some of the
buildings had been collapsed entirely
in Israeli airstrikes the rooms were
exposed to the outside families were
taking out pieces of broken furniture
and salvaging what they could from the
insides loading them away on donkey
carts and horses and old pickup trucks
with their families in tow
it's too early to tell whether the
ceasefire will hold both sides say that
any breach will be met with new violence
but the outside world is already turning
its attention to rebuilding promising
billions of dollars in reconstruction
aid that they hope will distract from
this latest skirmish in the arab-israeli
war
whoa
